claim: A claim that COVID-19 would have a deadline of “maximal infection” until April 3 in Brazil.
label: False

claim: The number of deaths from the novel coronavirus is tiny in comparison to the other causes of deaths.
label: MISLEADING

claim: The Spanish government stopped counting the dead from COVID-19 between March 6 and 9.
label: False

claim: COVID-19 not being blamed for deaths due to unrelated causes.
label: False

claim: Tire repairer who died in a work accident was included in the death figures for COVID-19.
label: False

claim: Video of dead bodies being thrown into a mass grave in Italy.
label: FALSE

claim: Brazilian Ministry of Health hinted that relatives of COVID-19 victims should doubt the death certificates.
label: False

claim: The viral text message claims that the chemical substances (methylxanthines) required to cure COVID-19 can be found in tea. Dr. Li Wenliang had found this cure while researching about coronavirus before his death.
label: False

claim: Sao Paulo governor’s decree artificially raises the number of COVID-19 deaths.
label: False

claim: A video claims to be of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau who is infected with coronavirus.
label: False

claim: A post claiming that Uganda recorded its first COVID-19 death on March 25.
label: False

claim: An image of a elderly man’s death in Italy.
label: False

claim: H1N1 was far more damaging to Brazil than COVID-19
label: False

claim: Israel applied “vertical lockdown” (younger, not at risk people are allowed to carry on their daily routines), and has the lowest death rate for COVID-19 in the world.
label: False

claim: COVID-19 contains a fragment of the deadly synthetic bacterium Cynthia.
label: FALSE
